title: About Me
text:
Iâ€™m originally from Manta Potrero, a small town in Paraguay. I began my agricultural career at the San Francisco Agricultural School in Cerrito, Paraguay. Since then, I have earned degrees from EARTH University in Costa Rica, UnADM in Mexico (On line), and Kansas State University in the United States. Along this journey, I have learned from and contributed to a variety of agricultural projects across regions.





Dissertation: â€œAssessing Phosphorus Management Strategies to Enhance Crop Productionâ€
Graduate Certificate: Applied Statistics
Advisor: Dorivar Ruiz Diaz
Committee: Ganga Hettiarachchi, Nathan Nelson, Christopher Valh



Report title: â€œBayesian Model Averaging Approach to Improve Fertilizer Recommendationsâ€
Advisor: Christopher Valh
Committee: Trevor Hefley, Josefina Lacasa, Dorivar Ruiz Diaz



Thesis: â€œEvaluating diagnostic tools for phosphorus and sulfur management in cornâ€
Advisor: Dorivar Ruiz Diaz
Committee: Ganga Hettiarachchi, Nathan Nelson, Christopher Valh



Thesis: â€œApplication of sulfur in wheat cultivation (Triticum aestivum): its importance for food securityâ€
Advisor: Eber Quintana
Committee: Mariela Gonzalez, Brenda Santiago, Dafne Orosco



Graduation Project: â€œDevelopment of a mobile application for the design and sizing of biodigestersâ€
Advisor: Mildred Linkimer
Honors: Distinguished student, fourth-year; Best graduation project presentation

ğŸ§ª Graduate Research Assistant (Jan 2021 â€“ Present)
- Led multidisciplinary research on phosphorus (P) and sulfur (S) management: calibration, residual P effects, long-term placement, and P & S interactions.
- Managed over 40 site-years with farmers and university fields; supervised interns and coordinated nutrient studies on corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum.
- Analyzed datasets and contributed to peer-reviewed publications and conference presentations.











ğŸ”¬ Research Assistant (Jul 2019 â€“ Dec 2020)
- Assisted with fertility trials, greenhouse experiments, and isotopic studies using Â¹âµN tracers.
- Managed sample processing and ensured data accuracy.
- Operated research equipment including planting and fertilizer application systems.














ğŸ– Production Intern (Ohio International Intern Program) (May 2018 â€“ Apr 2019)
- Supported daily swine production operations, health monitoring, and facility upkeep.
- Assisted with artificial insemination and farrowing, enhancing animal care protocols.
- Recorded growth data to support better farm management and animal welfare practices.












ğŸŒ Undergraduate Research Assistant, CIDER (Jan 2017 â€“ Dec 2017)
- Developed renewable energy projects: biodigesters, solar cooking, desalination, and pumping.
- Conducted biodigester research and organized outreach workshops.
- Collaborated on sustainable energy systems for rural communities.












â˜• Student Intern (SEPS Project) (Aug 2016 â€“ Dec 2016)
- Evaluated biodigester biosolids as fertilizer for coffee nurseries.
- Installed clean-energy systems and trained rural communities in their use.
- Designed and built gasification units for biochar and energy production.

title: Gustavo Roa
text:
Iâ€™m Gustavo Roa, a Ph.D.Â candidate in Agronomy at Kansas State University, focusing on soil fertility and nutrient management. My research explores phosphorus and sulfur fertilizer strategies in corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum using field trials, greenhouse studies, and isotopic tracer techniques (Â¹âµN). I complement my agronomic training with a strong foundation in applied statistics and data analysis.

Curriculum Vitae

title: Research & Teaching
text:
My research integrates field experimentation, greenhouse studies, and isotope tracer techniques to improve fertilizer recommendations and nutrient diagnostics in cropping systems. I work at the intersection of agronomy, soil chemistry, and data science to enhance phosphorus and sulfur use efficiency in corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum systems in Kansas and beyond.










ğŸ“ >40 site-years
Multi-location field trials across Kansas.











ğŸ§ª Â¹âµN tracers
Fertilizer N recovery in greenhouse + field.











ğŸ§® Models
Bayesian, Mixed/GAMs, ML for diagnostics & recs.











ğŸŒ¾ Crops
Corn, soybean, wheat, sorghum.









Phosphorus managementSulfur nutrition & diagnosticsÂ¹âµN isotopic tracersData science & modeling



Long-term P placement trials (18+ years)

Soil test calibration and critical level updates for corn

Plant tissue concentrations to support P recommendations




Corn response to S across multiple environments

S uptake, efficiency indices, and diagnostic tool validation

Integrating biomass, SPAD, NDVI, and tissue analysis




Greenhouse and field trials evaluating fertilizer N recovery

Partitioning N from soil, fertilizer, and atmospheric sources

Methodological advances and best practices




Bayesian statistics to improve fertilizer recommendations

ML for nutrient prediction; decision trees for recs

Mixed models and GAMs for long-term data

Sensitivity analyses in erosion modeling (RUSLE + GEE)
